intro: Hieracium rostanii subsp. korongyisense, commonly known as the Korongyisense hawkweed, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Hungary. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and leaf structures. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
